result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Anthony Ladeaux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:52 AM   Case called. Defendant Ryan Anthony Ladeaux in court, in custody without an attorney.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets record. 10:53 OFF THE RECORD.  10:55 AM  Court addresses parties as to off the record discussion of the recommendation from DOC which includes an error.  (recommenation is for a charge not in the complaint) COurt addresses State.  DA Poquette states his offer would heave been made based off of information in the DOC recommendation, which is not correct.  Court addresses DE.  DE would like an atty.  Deputy clerk was requested to call PD's office re DE's need for atty.  Reset.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 10, 2020 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Anthony Ladeaux in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Ryan Anthony Ladeaux in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered plea of NC to counts 1 and 2 in 15 CM 465 and NC to count 1 in 14 CM 440.  Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT:  15 CM 465:  Count 1 - 100 days county jail  with credit for 78 days time served - fine/costs $579.00

Count 2:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - restitution to Walmart $44.73 - fine/costs $589.00 - DNA sample/surcharge - AODA and any follow thru - No contact with Nicole Beaulieu - absolute sobriety no alcohol/drugs
